subject: News Summary
body:
CBSNews.com






July 5, 2007


                              		
                              		
                              	  Home | U.S. | World | Politics | SciTech | Health | Entertainment | Business | Opinion | Sports | Blogs | Interactives | Video

TOP STORIESFireworks Spark Deadly Shootings
Police in Cleveland say a man apparently angry about fireworks at a noisy Fourth of July party shot three people to death
                        and wounded two others. Another man was shot to death during an argument at a fireworks celebration near Seattle. More...Watch: Fireworks: What Not To Do
• West Still Sizzles Under Record Heat
                     					| Watch• Scores Of Children Rescued Off Irish Coast• U.K. Police Probe Alleged Bomb-Making Home
                     					| WatchU.S.14 Hurt In Colorado Building Collapse
A 14-story building under construction in a Denver suburb collapsed, seriously injuring four workers, a fire department spokesman
                        said. Ten others suffered minor injuries. More...
• Will 7/7/07 Be Your Lucky Day?• Third Child Pulled From Submerged Van Dies• West Still Sizzles Under Record Heat
                     					| Watch• More StoriesWorldScores Of Children Rescued Off Irish Coast
The Irish Coast Guard rescued about 110 children from the sea after a sudden squall hit their flotilla of dinghies, Irish
                        officials said. More...
• Explosions Rock Besieged Pakistani Mosque• U.K. Police Probe Alleged Bomb-Making Home
                     					| Watch• Al Qaeda Deputy Defends Iraqi Insurgents
                     					| Watch• More StoriesPoliticsBush Spokesman: Clintons Have "Chutzpah"
The White House took a shot at former President Clinton and his wife, Sen. Hillary Rodham Clinton, for criticizing President
                        Bush's decision to commute the prison sentence of former aide "Scooter" Libby. More...
• Cost Of Edwards' Haircut Hits $1,250• Meditating Iowans At Peace With Obama• Al Gore's Son Released From Jail
                     					| Watch• More StoriesHealthPanama Links Deaths To Contaminated Meds
A top Panamanian prosecutor says tests show at least 94 people have died from taking medicine contaminated with diethylene
                        glycol since July 2006. Another 293 deaths are under investigation. More...
• The Losing Fight Against Childhood Obesity• Screening May Lower Fertility For Some
                     					| Watch• China To Bolster Toothpaste Rules
                     					| Watch• More StoriesSciTechWho's The Chattier Sex?
Those who think women talk and talk and talk when compared to men should think again. New research suggests that when you
                        actually count the words, there isn't much difference between the sexes. More...
• Tahoe Fire May Hurt Lake's Health
                     					| Watch• China To Deny Bank Loans To Polluters
                     					| Watch• Turtles Test New Wireless Technology• More StoriesBusinessWorried Over A Possible Job Relocation?
So your employer has asked you to move to another job in another city. Resist saying yes immediately. It's easy to underestimate
                        the adjustment that a move will require. More...
• Senate Bill Tries To Revamp U.S. Tourism• Is Your Home Underinsured?
                     					| Watch• "Hot Fuel" Costing Consumers Big Bucks?
                     					| Watch• More StoriesEntertainmentBritney Explains Umbrella Attack
Britney Spears says she whacked a paparazzi's car with an umbrella a few months ago because she was preparing for a movie
                        role. More...
• Longoria-Parker Wedding Under Wraps• Aguilera Reportedly Expecting First Child
                     					| Watch• Mandy Moore Balances Music And Movies
                     					| Watch• More StoriesOpinionBoys Should Be Girls
CBS' Dick Meyer notes that women do better in college and right after it, and suggests that the Life Potato Syndrome
                        may be to blame. It's only the gender gap that has men earning more than women later in life.  More...
• Can Bush Raise His Ratings?• Supreme Uncertainty
                     					| Watch• Growing Out Of Control
                     					| Watch• More StoriesCBS NEWS BROADCASTSThe Early Show: Recipes: Chefs Cook Up Firefighters' Fundraiser
They hope Sunday's dinner and auction will raise $300,000 for the families of the firefighters lost in the blaze in a Charleston
                        furniture showroom last month. One of the chefs, Bob Waggoner, discussed the effort on The Early Show. More...Watch: S.C. Fire Fundraiser Recipes

Al Gore's Son Arrested Al Gore III, son of the former vice president, was charged with possession of marijuana and pharmaceutical drugs for which
                                    he did not have prescriptions. Michelle Miller reports.
